intro: Alyxia poyaensis, commonly known as the Poyas piper, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent, tubular corona. Alyxia poyaensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
